meanings.definition: The act of ordaining or conferring holy orders.
meanings.sent1: During the ordinations, the bishop blessed the new priests.
meanings.sent2: The ordinations took place in the grand cathedral.
meanings.sent3: The ordinations were so solemn that even the birds outside fell silent.
meanings.sent4: The ordinations were like a sacred dance, each step carefully planned.
meanings.sent5: The ordinations left a lasting impression on all who witnessed them.

meanings.definition: The arrangement or ordering of something.
meanings.sent1: The ordinations of the books on the shelf were neat and tidy.
meanings.sent2: She spent hours on the ordinations of the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The ordinations of the chairs in the room seemed to change every day.
meanings.sent4: The ordinations of the stars in the sky created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: His meticulous ordinations of the tools in the workshop impressed his colleagues.

meanings.definition: The process of officially selecting or appointing someone to a position or role.
meanings.sent1: The ordinations for the new CEO will take place next week.
meanings.sent2: She was thrilled to be part of the ordinations for the team captain.
meanings.sent3: The ordinations for the class president were met with cheers and applause.
meanings.sent4: The ordinations for the lead actor in the play caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent5: His ordinations for the key positions in the company were strategic and well-thought-out.
